transcript:
more than Boris, be- gan to speak with a feeling of mingled shame and vexation. 
"Well, this is strange! Do you suppose I ... who could think? ... I know very well . . ." 
But Boris again interrupted him. 
"I am glad I have spoken out fully. Perhaps you did not like it? You must excuse me," said he, putting Pierre at ease instead of being put at ease by him, "but I hope I have not offended you. I always make it a rule to speak out. . . . 
Well, what answer am I to take? Will you come to dinner
